channel.title: CVE Feed for IBM -- Cloud Private
channel.description: The latest CVEs for IBM -- Cloud Private

item.title: CVE-2018-1939|2024-09-16T18:14:30.293Z -- ibm -- cloud%20private
item.description: IBM Cloud Private 3.1.1 could allow a remote attacker to conduct phishing attacks, using an open redirect attack. By persuading a victim to visit a specially-crafted Web site, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to spoof the URL displayed to redirect a user to a malicious Web site that would appear to be trusted. This could allow the attacker to obtain highly sensitive information or conduct further attacks against the victim. IBM X-Force ID: 153319.

item.title: CVE-2018-1943|2024-09-16T18:29:25.910Z -- ibm -- cloud%20private
item.description: IBM Cloud Private 3.1.0 and 3.1.1 is vulnerable to HTTP HOST header injection, caused by improper validation of input. By persuading a victim to visit a specially-crafted Web page, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to inject arbitrary HTTP headers, which will allow the attacker to conduct various attacks against the vulnerable system, including cross-site scripting, cache poisoning or session hijacking. IBM X-Force ID: 153385.

item.title: CVE-2019-4120|2024-09-16T20:17:38.712Z -- ibm -- cloud%20private
item.description: IBM Cloud Private 3.1.1 and 3.1.2 is vulnerable to cross-site scripting. This vulnerability allows users to embed arbitrary JavaScript code in the Web UI thus altering the intended functionality potentially leading to credentials disclosure within a trusted session. IBM X-Force ID: 158146.

item.title: CVE-2018-1938|2024-09-16T18:03:16.403Z -- ibm -- cloud%20private
item.description: IBM Cloud Private 3.1.1 could alllow a local user with administrator privileges to intercept highly sensitive unencrypted data. IBM X-Force ID: 153318.

item.title: CVE-2019-4119|2024-09-16T18:44:04.593Z -- ibm -- cloud%20private
item.description: IBM Cloud Private Kubernetes API server 2.1.0, 3.1.0, 3.1.1, and 3.1.2 can be used as an HTTP proxy to not only cluster internal but also external target IP addresses. IBM X-Force ID: 158145.

item.title: CVE-2019-4116|2024-09-16T18:09:25.131Z -- ibm -- cloud%20private
item.description: IBM Cloud Private 2.1.0, 3.1.0, and 3.1.1 could disclose highly sensitive information in installer logs that could be use for further attacks against the system. IBM X-Force ID: 158115.

item.title: CVE-2019-4142|2024-09-16T18:48:56.262Z -- ibm -- cloud%20private
item.description: IBM Cloud Private 2.1.0, 3.1.0, 3.1.1, and 3.1.2 is vulnerable to cross-site request forgery which could allow an attacker to execute malicious and unauthorized actions transmitted from a user that the website trusts. IBM X-Force ID: 158338.

item.title: CVE-2018-1843|2024-09-16T18:04:24.106Z -- ibm -- cloud%20private
item.description: The Identity and Access Management (IAM) services (IBM Cloud Private 3.1.0) do not use a secure channel, such as SSL, to exchange information only when accessed internally from within the cluster. It could be possible for an attacker with access to network traffic to sniff packets from the connection and uncover data. IBM X-Force ID: 150903

item.title: CVE-2019-4439|2024-09-16T17:43:10.762Z -- ibm -- cloud%20private
item.description: IBM Cloud Private 3.1.0, 3.1.1, and 3.1.2 does not invalidate session after logout which could allow a local user to impersonate another user on the system. IBM X-Force ID: 162949.
